cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or other undefined behavior.
explanation: The code contains an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. In the initial for loop (for (i = 0; i < datalen; i += 2)), the code accesses data[i + 1]. A check for datalen % 2 != 0 is performed later in the function, but it occurs after this initial loop. If an attacker provides an odd datalen, the loop will iterate up to i = datalen - 1 (if datalen > 0), and the access data[i + 1] will read one byte past the end of the data buffer, leading to an out-of-bounds read.

cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer. This can lead to crashes or the exposure of sensitive information.
explanation: The code contains an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. In the first for loop, for (i = 0; i < datalen; i += 2), the code accesses data[i + 1]. A check for datalen % 2 != 0 occurs after this loop. If datalen is an odd number, the loop will execute when i is datalen - 1, leading to an attempt to read data[datalen], which is beyond the allocated buffer, before the odd length is detected.
